Title: Object: The Black Decree
Description: A broadside with a Christmas carols and hymns with five wood-engravings showing at the top centre Christ feeding the Five Thousands, on the left the Nativity, and Flight into Egypt, The Baptism of Christ, and Christ teaching in the Temple; and with letterpress title and verses in four columns. ([London], Pitts: [ c.1820])
Dimensions: Height: 147 millimetres (wood-engraving, Christ feeding the Five Thousands)
Width: 199 millimetres (wood-engraving, Christ feeding the Five Thousands)
Curator's comments: The verses are those of two sections from Handel's oratorio The Messiah, of the carol "Christians Awake", the hymn "The Black Decree" (which relates to the Massacre of the Innocents), "O, See Man's Saviour in Bethlehem Born", "On Christmas Night all Christians sing", "Shepherds Watch their Flock by Night", and a Christmas Hymn (translated from the Portuguese) on the Nativity.
